description: From Middle English helly, hellic, from Old English hellīċ (“of hell, hellish, infernal”), equivalent to hell +‎ -y.

adjectives.description: helly (comparative more helly, superlative most helly)

examples: These monster-swarms his Holiness and his helly crew have scraped and raked together out of old doting historiographers, wizardising augurs, imposturing soothsayers, dreaming poets, chimerical conceiters, and coiners of fables,  […] .
